RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: URBAN BANDIT rated close toward the inside on the opening turn then eased outward into the backstretch, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, drew to even terms three wide midway on the far turn and dug in under steady handling to take over in the final strides. UNION LEAGUE veered out and hit the gate at the break then tapered in to stalk two deep, challenged approaching the seven sixteenths pole, dueled at even terms two deep while between horses midway on the far turn, dug in for a slim lead mid-stretch but was outfinished in the final strides. MR. COWBOY BRADLEY rated a slim lead inside, dug in to the challenge of Union League and kept the edge from the seven sixteenths pole, was met at even terms nearest the rail midway on the far turn and remained a factor to mid-stretch before flattening stride. PLAYBOY ROY rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, left the turn outside and could only close the gap. MISS YOU AJAX raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the four path, then could only close the gap in the lane. CRYPTIC CODE dropped well back.

ENTRY.NAME: Urban Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,eased out 1/2,bid 7/16,3wd turn,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRAPPE THE GOLD accelerated to the front passing the three eighths pole, rounded the turn at the rail and held well under steady stretch handling. HAGGERSDALE set a pressured early pace then pressed the winner passing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path on the turn but dropped back past the eighth pole and settled for second. SEIZE THE BREEZE chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. THE CLOWN gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and had little left. DIVINING DANCER lacked speed while saving ground. PERSONAL FINANCE gave chase then faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Trappe the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: up past 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,held well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 8, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since March 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

RACE.FOOTNOTES: INCLUDE THE BEAST was hustled to the front leaving the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at even terms, contested the rail through the turn and dug in determinedly to draw clear of THUNDER PUNCH through later yards. The latter pressured the pace at even terms from the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the turn and reluctantly ceded later yards. GARY DOING BIZ became fractious in the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. AT THE HALF chased through the backstretch, was eased outward on the turn and left the turn outside, then lugged in later yards. KOBE'S GIRL gave chase and raced at the rail on the turn. PRAY FOR THE U S A chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Include the Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up past 7/16,dueled even terms,rail turn,determined lane

ENTRY.NAME: At the Half
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,eased out turn,lugged in later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Pray for the U S A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL LUCERITO took the lead passing the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure a furlong later, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the lane. HARDLY EVER BETTER engaged in close early chase from the seven sixteenths pole, dropped back approaching the quarter pole but dug in to clear second later yards. TEACHINTHERELEASE chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. REATA'S CASTLE gave chase, entered the turn about the three path but left the turn outside and flattened stride. COLT ROCK gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and weakened in the lane. ELEANORS JACK gave chase then faded off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Hardly Ever Better
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,dropped back near 1/4,clear 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL PACHO took the lead on the chute and rated the early pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in under steady handling to hold on. KARMA BUS chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and finished well at the outside flank of the winner. GREY BOUQUET flipped behind the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn off the rail, then flattened stride later yards. LORD CLANCY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened stride later yards. DIMELO PAPI chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. ARYA CHARMING chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and proved empty in the lane. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path. ESPRESSO gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then lost his rider mid-stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Karma Bus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Grey Bouquet
ENTRY.COMMENT: flipped behind gate,chased,off rail turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE SEPTEMBER 8, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FORTES gave distant chase toward the inside, was eased outward through the turn and left the turn about the six path, then steadily closed to take the nod under the wire. TIZ THE REASON accelerated to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement but was nipped under the wire. LIKING IT TWISTED chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn then came along for third while outfinished for second in later yards. BLACK PANDA gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. LITTLE BIT OF THAT chased through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn and remained a factor to late stretch before flattening stride. GRANDIOSELY chased, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. R WORKING GIRL broke a step slow and lacked speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Fortes
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant chase,eased out turn,6p 1/8,steadily improved,up at wire

ENTRY.NAME: Little Bit of That
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since August 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BABA drew clear and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the stretch. BARBERS POINT stalked off the rail, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole and dueled through the stretch for second. REVEIRS MINUTE rated close inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. DIAL HER settled off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, angled out leaving the turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride.

ENTRY.NAME: Dial Her
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 7/16,off rail turn,flattened late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Baba
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured nearing 1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCARE DEM was pinched back early and rounded the first turn off the rail, eased out with a bid into the backstretch and steadily improved from that point, raced in the five path on the far turn and dug in widest to get up the final strides. CALLISTO'S BRIGADE was forced in early then stalked off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and finished well to overtake LAST PARTY in the final strides. The latter lugged in early then rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and dug in under steady encouragement through the stretch, but was caught while flattening stride the final strides. MOON FALL was forced inward and into Dog Town Allen early then saved ground well off the pace, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out entering the stretch and finished well. LITTLE RICHIE raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened in the lane. DENIZETTI stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and weakened in the stretch. DOG TOWN ALLEN was bumped early and rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Scare Dem
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched early,off rail 1st turn,chased 1/2,5p turn,up widest late

ENTRY.NAME: Callisto's Brigade
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in early,stalked,chased 7/16,off rail turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M
ENTRY.COMMENT: lugged in early,rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail turn,flattened late
